Welcome to pySPC’s documentation!¶

MVC pattern¶

pySPC uses a Model View Controller (MVC) pattern

The Model (which is contained in the repertory named core) is the heart of the software.

It is totally independant.

You can (and sometimes you better should) use it separately, typically with scripts (using it a jupyter notebook is a very efficient way to document ).

The Model and the view are here for the Graphical User Interface (GUI).

The Core (Model in MVC)¶

The GUI (View and Controller in MVC)¶

class Experiment.Experiment(exp_param=None, results=None, data=None)[source]¶

Root class of the model (named here “core”) of the MVC pattern.

main members : - exp_param - results - data

main methods : - new_exp - save_state/load_state

new_exp(mode, params)[source]¶

Create a new experiment from a file or from simulated data.

Parameters:
  • mode – a string telling how to create the new experiment. Can be : - “file” : a recorded file spc or pt3 file - “generate” : Poissonian Noise - “simulation” : Not Implemented Yet.
  • params –

    params passed to the function based on the mode : - for “file mode :

    • params[0] = filePath
    • for “generate” :
      • params[0] = filePath
      • params[1] = time_s
      • params[2] = count_per_second_s
Returns:

find_idx_of_fit_limit(idx_start, idx_end)[source]¶

User selection of a a specific part of a graph is often based on a arbitraty value on the x axis This method find the correspoding index of the photon

Parameters:
  • idx_start – lowest x value of the user selected interval. Default is 0
  • idx_end – highest x value of the user selected interval. Default is -1, that is to say latest value
Returns:
